title: BJP seeks withdrawal of user fee for garbage handling in Bengaluru

title: Belagavi women feature in film screened at Cannes film festival The Second Wind

title: Odisha increases upper age limit of government jobs from 32 to 42
content: It will also come up with Odisha Artificial Intelligence Policy-2025 for improving governance, stimulating innovation, enhancing data-driven decision-making and enabling inclusive socio-economic development

title: Isolated heavy rain likely as southwest monsoon reaches Vizag
content: Santhabommali of Srikakulam district records 152.4 mm of rain in 24 hours ending Wednesday morning, while Ichchapuram records 31.5 mm by 5 pm

title: Producer Dil Raju made me scapegoat, says suspended JSP leader

title: Do Roti and a world of difference: activist’s simple recipe to tackle hunger, ignite humanity

title: PUCL questions ‘inaction’ against hate speech and communalism

title: Veteran Akali leader Sukhdev Singh Dhindsa dies at 89; political leaders express grief
content: Political leaders across parties condoled the death of Dhindsa, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi calling him a “towering statesman with great wisdom and an unwavering commitment to public service”

title: The importance of the Deputy Speaker
content: The Deputy Speaker is not a mere substitute of the Speaker; he plays an indispensable role in maintaining the continuity of legislative work. Conventionally, this position has been handed over to the Opposition, in order to develop harmony between the ruling party and the Opposition

title: All-party delegations receive support from world leaders in India’s fight against terror
content: India has tasked seven multi-party delegations to visit 33 global capitals to reach out to the international community on Pakistan’s designs and India’s response to terror

title: Karnataka clears investments worth ₹17,182 crore with potential to create 12,496 direct jobs
content: State High-Level Clearance Committee headed by the Chief Minister and the State-Level Single-Window Clearance Committee headed by the Large and Medium Industries Minister clear projects

title: Huma Qureshi attends tourism event in Jammu, praises forces for Operation Sindoor
content: Amid chants of ‘Bharat Mata Ki Jai’, Ms. Qureshi interacted with the border guards, including its women personnel, who were on the forefront during Operation Sindoor to counter cross-border shelling and drone attacks by Pakistan

title: Foreign students face uncertainty as Trump steps up attack on universities
content: In April, the federal government froze more than $2 billion in grants and contracts with Harvard, citing non-compliance with requests to modify hiring and admissions policies, dismantle diversity-equity-inclusion programmes, and conduct ideological vetting of international students

title: MLAs from Madiga community meet Meenakshi Natarajan, make fresh demand for Cabinet berths
content: In a memorandum submitted to Meenakshi Natarajan, they underscored the community’s strong support for the Congress, both historically and in the recent Telangana Assembly election

title: Delhi, followed by Maharashtra, sent back the most number of ‘illegal’ Bangladeshi immigrants
content: In the past six months, a number of allegedly ‘illegal’ immigrants from Bangladesh have been detained in the BJP-ruled States of Delhi, Maharashtra, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, and Goa

title: Parents of slain R.G. Kar doctor back junior colleagues facing ‘punishment postings’
content: Allege silent crackdown on protestors who demanded justice; also extend support to agitating teachers facing legal action

title: JKPCC chief Tariq Hameed Karra slams J&K’s ‘dual control’ as undemocratic, demands full Statehood
content: Congress leader warned that the current system could further destabilise the Union Territory, and highlighted “cash crunch” and “lack of MLA funds” as needing urgent government attention.

title: Stalin to inaugurate free houses for Irular families near Arakkonam today
content: State Highways Department provided the land and built the new houses after the patta land given to the families by the district administration was acquired by the department for widening of the Kancheepuram-Arakkonam-Tiruttani Road

title: Early onset of monsoon catches GHMC off guard

title: Maharashtra government approves Dharavi project master plan
content: Top priority of the project should be rehabilitation of local artisans and small unit owners, says Fadnavis

title: U.S. Embassy, consulates in India put new student visa appointments on pause
content: It is unclear how long the pause on student visa appointments will continue, raising questions over admissions for Indian and other international students for the new term beginning in September 2025

title: Trump used offers of trade access to broker India-Pakistan ceasefire, claims U.S. Commerce Secretary
content: U.S. officials tell court that tariffs are key to U.S. national security, citing India-Pakistan ceasefire; MEA insisted ceasefire did not involve U.S. mediation, said trade was not part of talks with U.S. on Operation Sindoor

title: NHAI to construct viaduct to replace collapsed NH-66
content: NHAI regional officer says bridge appeared the only remedial measure to address the failure of the 276-metre stretch of the elevated highway at Kooriyad

title: Vigil continues as heavy rain hits normal life in Kozhikode

title: U.P. CM Yogi reviews preparations in Kanpur ahead of PM Modi’s visit on May 30
content: Modi will visit the city to inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for a slew of development projects

title: HC stays order finding former Coimbatore Collector, DRO, RDO, and Tahsildar guilty of contempt
content: A summer vacation Bench of Justices Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy and T.V. Thamilselvi grant interim stay for a period of four weeks following individual appeals filed by the officers

title: Assam to issue arms licences to indigenous people living in vulnerable areas
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said militarisation of such people was not the motive behind the Cabinet decision

title: Free movement will take time, government tells Meiteis
content: Centre tells them this is not achievable in a few months or weeks, does not give any timeline to resolve issues; groups raise concerns over politicians normalising Manipur’s ethnic violence

title: WHO advises risk-based plan to tackle COVID-19 spread
content: India has reported over 1,000 cases of COVID-19 this year so far, according to data released by the Central government

title: Congress accuses BJP of undermining local governance in Rajasthan
content: Opposition terms ‘one State, one election’ slogan a political stunt; questions raised over delimitation, delay in local body polls

title: ANI media moves Delhi HC against YouTuber
content: The news agency has alleged that a recent video published on Mohak Mangal’s channel contains false, misleading, and defamatory statements that have caused serious harm to its business and reputation

title: CPI MP writes a letter to all political parties calling for an impeachment against Allahabad HC judge Yashwant Varma
content: P. Sandhosh Kumar is the second Rajya Sabha member after Congress’s Vivek Tankha to raise demand, citing the constitutional empowerment of the Parliament to impeach Justice Varma.

title: Technical failure in ballast water management could have led to sinking of ship, say officials
content: Shipping officials said although the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) had not issued any age-related norms for ships, there were concerns about the operational efficiency of older vessels.

title: Audit platforms for ‘dark patterns’, Consumer Affairs Ministry warns companies
content: Following a surge in ‘dark patterns’ - deceptive design techniques to nudge users to take certain action on apps and websites - the government told private sector players to audit their platforms

title: Webinar series by SRMIST and The Hindu to explore future of humanities and sciences
content: First session of ‘Future Conversations’ will be held on May 31 to discuss building real-world skills, with Prof. A. Vinay Kumar of SRMIST, Prof. A. Joseph Dorairaj among panelists.

title: Leading with compassion: Chief Minister releases biography of nephrologist H. Sudarshan Ballal
content: More than a traditional biography, this book serves as a vital resource for aspiring medical professionals and leaders globally

title: NHRC notice to Jharkhand over custodial death
content: The victim’s family members alleged that he was physically tortured in police custody, resulting in his death

title: Punjab, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Haryana, Chandigarh postpone civil defence exercise
content: According to an official statement, the civil defence exercise has been postponed due to administrative reasons and a new date will be announced soon

title: Amit Shah to visit Jammu and Poonch on May 29, 30
content: Besides reviewing the security arrangements for the Amarnath Yatra, the Minister is likely to visit Poonch, which saw killings and destruction of properties in shelling and firing from Pakistan after Operation Sindoor

title: Kozhikode Corporation to approach NHAI over waterlogging
content: The mayor says steps will be taken to address issues like waterlogging near the national highway and that members can approach the Corporation with details

title: Degree admissions: Universities see renewed interest in life sciences
content: The growth of Bengaluru as a biotechnology hub is one of the reasons for the renewed interest, according to university managements

title: Kerala govt. plans law to allow regulated culling of wild animals endangering human lives and raiding crop lands
content: Government seeks Advocate General’s opinion on whether the proposed law will conflict with the Indian Wildlife Act, 1972. It tasks Principal Secretary, Forests, to work with Principal Secretary, Law, to submit proposals for the draft Bill

title: Pakistan link: Himanta-Gaurav spat intensifies
content: The Assam Chief Minister alleged the Jorhat MP and his wife were deeply involved in anti-India activities after the latter admitted he visited Pakistan in 2013

title: Kerala HC upholds cooperative society Act amendment
content: Amendment bars members of managing committees of credit societies from contesting to the committees for more than three consecutive terms

title: Siraj and Sameer sent to central jail in Visakhapatnam
content: The two have been arrested on charges of making IEDs and plotting to trigger blasts in Vizianagaram and other places in the State, and later sent to one week police custody

title: Supreme Court directs Assam Human Rights Commission to probe allegations of police encounters
content: ‘The victims’ voices must be heard, not as a matter of courtesy but as a matter of right,’ the court said, directing the Human Rights Commission to notify the victims

title: Thunder steamroll into first NBA Finals since '12
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander had 34 points, and the Thunder finished off the Wolves with a 124-94 win in Game 5 on Wednesday night to advance to the NBA Finals for the first time since 2012.

title: Panthers to Cup Final: 'This year, it's all business'
content: The Panthers advanced to their third straight Stanley Cup Final with a 5-3 victory over the Hurricanes in Game 5 on Wednesday night.

title: Williams makes it clear he wanted to be a Bear
content: Bears quarterback Caleb Williams on Wednesday defended his commitment to the organization that drafted him with the No. 1 pick in 2024.

title: Fever fall without Clark: 'A kind of gut punch'
content: The Fever's first game without star Caitlin Clark was rockier than they'd hoped, as they lost to the Mystics on Wednesday night in Baltimore.

title: Texas' Miller: No COVID year to hurt veteran depth
content: Texas coach Sean Miller said the lower number of players with an extra year of eligibility from the COVID-19 eligibility rules will hurt college basketball next season.

title: Vrabel stresses decision-making amid Diggs video
content: The Patriots are aware of the video in which Stefon Diggs flashed an unidentified pink substance while surrounded by three women on a boat, coach Mike Vrabel said Wednesday.

title: Messi, Suárez score 2 each in lopsided Miami win
content: Luis Suárez and Lionel Messi each finished with two goals and an assist to lead host Inter Miami to a 4-2 victory over CF Montreal on Wednesday night in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

title: Adelman wants Nuggets in even better condition
content: New Nuggets coach David Adelman, who was officially introduced Wednesday, wants his team to be in even better condition and open to new ideas come training camp.

title: The 2025 NFL season FPI projections are out: Eagles at No. 1, Saints at No. 32 in our debut ratings
content: ESPN's Football Power Index ratings are live. Let's predict the 2025 season, including playoff chances for 32 teams and potential draft order.

title: The five most astounding stats behind the 100-game stretch when the Tigers have ruled MLB
content: Detroit has been the best team in baseball since Aug. 11 of last season. Here's a breakdown of how it has done it.

content: Former players, coaches on how Oklahoma softball coach Patty Gasso became the sport's greatest coach.

content: The 80th U.S. Women's Open figures to be a tough test at Erin Hills Club. We break down some of the biggest things to watch ahead of the LPGA's second major of the year.

title: Chelsea didn't spend £1 billion to win the Conference League, but it's a start
content: The mere fact they were in the UECL is a reflection of the mistakes made to this point, but Chelsea's triumph on Wednesday can be the foundation for a far brighter future.

title: Chelsea eye more glory after sealing UEFA title set
content: Enzo Maresca believes Chelsea's Conference League success could be a "starting point" for further glory after ending the club's four-year wait for silverware.

title: Isco: Chelsea 'ran over us' in second-half collapse
content: Real Betis paid the price for taking their foot off the pedal after an impressive first half in Wednesday's Conference League final defeat by Chelsea, said their inspirational captain Isco and veteran coach Manuel Pellegrini.

title: Man Utd booed off after friendly loss in Malaysia
content: Manchester United were booed by fans at the final whistle after losing 1-0 in Malaysia against ASEAN All-Stars on Friday.

title: 'United' Miami adapt after Alba, Lujan injuries
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano commended his players for coming together and being "united" in a 4-2 win over Montreal at Chase Stadium on Wednesday night despite suffering three injuries in the first half.

title: James: Chelsea 'had to win' Conference League
content: Chelsea beat Real Betis in the Conference League final on Wednesday, sealing a preseason ambition to lift the trophy that Reece James believed they had to win.

title: Dress to impress: Inter to wear gold for UCL final
content: Inter Milan will dress for the occasion by wearing their third, golden yellow kit in Saturday's Champions League final when they face Paris Saint-Germain in Munich.

title: Henry: Arsenal have underachieved under Arteta
content: Arsenal legend Thierry Henry has said he believes the club should have won a trophy under Mikel Arteta.

content: Former Clippers assistant Natalie Nakase helped the Aces win two WNBA titles. Now she's in her first season as the head coach of the Valkyries.

content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

content: Bill Connelly begins his conference previews with the MAC, which still has some high-level talent despite portal losses.

content: The race to acquire Hugo Ekitike has begun, with Liverpool and Chelsea set to fight for his signature.

content: The French Open is the last of the majors to use human line judges -- and it's been a topic of debate in Paris.

title: Norris' win in Monaco has reset F1, McLaren title fight
content: Preseason title favorite Lando Norris was losing steam to teammate Oscar Piastri. That's no longer the case.

title: Grading how every SEC team performed in 2024-25
content: With a record 14 NCAA tournament bids, it's no surprise the SEC earned the most A's among power conferences.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: Finding the next hidden breakout aces
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft tries to figure out how to identify pitchers who might become the next big thing.

title: Security Drills In Border Districts Of States Neighbouring Pakistan Postponed
content: After the government decided to carry out a civil defence exercise on Thursday in states and Union Territories adjoining the western border, Haryana, Rajasthan and Punjab on Wednesday postponed the scheduled mock drill.

title: US Court Blocks Trump Tariffs, Rejects "India-Pak Ceasefire" Argument
content: A US trade court on Wednesday blocked Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' import tariffs from going into effect, ruling that the President overstepped his authorities with the across-the-board duties on countries that sell more to the US than they buy.

title: 2 Hybrid Terrorist Arrested With Weapons In J&K's Shopian District
content: Police said on Thursday that it has arrested two hybrid terrorists along with arms and ammunition in Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Shopian district.

title: Pune Porsche Case Accused Doctor Now Arrested In Kidney Transplant Racket
content: Police on Thursday arrested Pune's Sassoon General Hospital's former medical superintendent Dr Ajay Taware in connection with an alleged kidney transplant racket at a leading private hospital here, officials said.

title: China Urges US To Protect "Academic Exchanges" Amid Trump's Visa Freeze
content: China has called on the United States to avoid "disrupting" education and academic exchanges after the Trump administration froze all student visa interviews and appointments at US embassies and consulates worldwide.

title: Teen Dies By Suicide After Family Opposes Her Relationship With Cousin
content: A 16-year-old girl allegedly committed suicide at her home in Maharashtra's Thane district after her family opposed her relationship with a male cousin, police said on Thursday.

title: "Don't Want To See Shopping Centres Explode": Trump On Foreign Students
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday called international students "troublemakers" and suggested a 15 per cent cap should be imposed on the admission of foreign students at Harvard University and other American higher education institutions.

title: Elon Musk-Donald Trump Bromance: From DOGE To Doghouse
content: US President Donald Trump's billionaire ally, Elon Musk, on Wednesday announced he was leaving his position within the US government leading the so-called Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) intended to reduce federal spending.

title: Dance Teacher, 28, Arrested For Sex Assault On Minor Girl In Bengaluru
content: The accused, identified as Bharathi Kannan, was driving a car when he stopped near the victim, who was walking on the road.

title: "My Time Comes To An End': Elon Musk Exits Donald Trump Government
content: Space and technology billionaire Elon Musk announced that his term as the chief of the Department of Government Efficiency has come to an end.

title: MK Stalin To Inaugurate Permanent Housing For Displaced Irular Families
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin will virtually inaugurate newly-built houses for 41 displaced Irular families at Melpakkam village near Arakkonam in Ranipet district on Thursday.

title: 'Meta AI Bot, Gen AI, Used A Billion Times Monthly': Mark Zuckerberg
content: Mark Zuckerberg noted the milestone anew at Meta's annual gathering of shareholders and as the social media behemoth vies with Google, Microsoft, OpenAI and others to be a leader in Gen AI.

title: Nigerian TikTok Star 'Sprayed' Money Into Air At A Party, Jailed For 6 Months
content: A Nigerian court on Wednesday sentenced a popular TikToker to six months in jail for "spraying" the local naira currency into the air at a party, a common local celebratory practice.

title: PM Modi To Launch Development Projects In Sikkim, West Bengal Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to attend the golden jubilee celebrations marking 50 years of Sikkim's statehood at the Paljor Stadium in Gangtok on Thursday.

title: NASA's Starliner Crew Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore Finish Recovery On Earth
content: Sunita Williams and Butch, who last year set off for an eight-day Starliner test flight that swelled into a nine-month stay in space, have had to readapt their muscles, sense of balance and other basics of Earth.

title: On Camera, Haryana Minister Gets Stuck In Lift In Chandigarh
content: A video of the incident went viral, in which the minister can be seen standing with at least eight other people in the lift.

title: BSF Prepares For Makeover With Digital Camouflage Pattern Uniform
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) will soon get a makeover with a new digital camouflage pattern uniform for its jawans, officials have said.

title: "Not An Iota Of Credible Evidence": Lokpal's Clean Chit To Ex-SEBI Chief Madhabi Buch
content: Anti-corruption ombudsman Lokpal on Wednesday disposed of complaints alleging impropriety and conflict of interest against former SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch based on a Hindenburg Research report, terming the charges as "presumptions and assumptions

title: PM Modi Begins 2-Day Tour Of Sikkim, Bihar, West Bengal, UP
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to embark on a two-day tour of Sikkim, West Bengal, Bihar, and Uttar Pradesh on May 29 and 30.

title: Israel And UN Clash Over Aid To Gaza
content: Israel accused the United Nations Wednesday of seeking to "block" Gaza aid distribution, as the global body said it was doing its utmost to gather the limited assistance greenlighted by Israel's authorities.

title: Trump’s 'big beautiful bill', budget cuts miss the mark: 5 reasons why Musk may have walked away
content: Elon Musk concluded his advisory role to President Trump, casting shadows on the future of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Musk cited the end of his term as a Special Government Employee and disagreements over Trump's "big beautiful bill" as key factors. Frustration with bureaucratic hurdles and limited success in achieving substantial spending cuts also contributed to his decision.

title: Rajasthan govt employee, assistant to Congress neta, held for spying for ISI
content: A state government employee in Rajasthan, Sakur Khan Mangaliyar, has been detained on suspicion of spying for Pakistan's ISI. The arrest follows a wider crackdown on espionage networks after Op Sindoor. Authorities are investigating possible links between Mangaliyar and a Congress politician, as well as his frequent trips to Pakistan and suspicious phone activity.

title: 'For sake of peace': After Op Sindoor, Pak changes tune, calls for dialogue with India
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has again expressed his willingness to engage in dialogue with India to resolve critical issues such as Kashmir, water sharing, and terrorism. This call for peace follows a similar statement made earlier in the week, amidst heightened tensions following a recent terrorist attack and India's retaliatory military actions.

title: Elon Musk’s 72-hr ‘ultimatum’ to Apple that may have split Tim Cook’s team
content: In 2022, Elon Musk issued a 72-hour ultimatum to Apple, demanding a $5 billion deal for SpaceX to become the exclusive satellite provider for iPhones. Apple rejected the offer, leading to a three-year conflict involving regulatory challenges and internal dissent within Apple regarding its satellite strategy. Despite the challenges and internal resistance, Apple has invested heavily in Globalstar, signaling its commitment to satellite connectivity.

title: Cab fight at Mumbai airport: Driver drags rival on bonnet for kilometres
content: A petty argument between two cab drivers escalated into a dangerous situation at Mumbai airport. Justin J jumped onto Bhimprasad Mahanto's cab bonnet, who then sped off onto the Western Express Highway. A video of Justin clinging to the speeding car went viral. Police detained Mahanto and seized his vehicle after Justin filed a complaint.

title: BJP MP cites declassified letter to Rajiv Gandhi questioning nuclear pact
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey alleged that the 1988 India-Pakistan nuclear agreement occurred under US pressure during Rajiv Gandhi's tenure. Sharing a purported declassified letter from Ronald Reagan, Dubey claimed the US dictated the agenda. He questioned Congress's silence and accused past governments of aligning with US interests, citing examples like Afghanistan and the Shimla Agreement.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Should you buy or sell today?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: MCX Gold is resuming its upward trend, potentially reaching 98,000, supported by geopolitical tensions and inflationary concerns. MCX Silver exhibits strong bullish momentum, targeting 1,01,800, driven by robust demand and macroeconomic uncertainties.

title: When Vaniya Agrawal made Microsoft exec 'stumble' & reveal Walmart's AI plans
content: At Microsoft's Build 2025 conference, a protest by ex-employees Vaniya Agrawal and Hossam Nasr against the company's Israeli contracts led to an accidental leak of Walmart's AI expansion plans. During the disruption, private Teams messages revealed Walmart's enthusiasm for Microsoft's AI security and its upcoming use of Entra Web and AI Gateway.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 24,850; BSE Sensex rises over 500 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While Nifty50 went above 24,850, BSE Sensex rose over 500 points.

title: 'Limit to political desperation': BJP wades into Cong crossfire as Udit Raj targets Tharoor
content: Amidst internal discord within the Congress party, Shashi Tharoor faces criticism from colleague Udit Raj over remarks lauding India's counterterror strikes during an international delegation visit. BJP leaders, including Kiren Rijiju and Shehzad Poonawalla, have rallied around Tharoor, questioning Congress's commitment to national interest.

title: Elon Musk to exit US govt role after criticising Trump's 'big beautiful bill': 10 things to know
content: Elon Musk concluded his tenure as a Special Government Employee, stepping down as a top adviser to President Trump amid disagreements over a controversial spending bill. Musk's departure follows his criticism of the "One Big, Beautiful Bill Act," citing concerns about its impact on the budget deficit.

title: Google cofounder on why he is back to work almost every day, six-years after retirement
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has returned from retirement to actively contribute to the company's AI development, driven by the transformative potential of generative AI. Brin is deeply involved in training Google's Gemini models, aiming for artificial general intelligence. He considers AI more impactful than previous tech revolutions, focusing on expanding Google's computational capabilities to meet the surging demand.

title: Why China is going behind the asteroids with its Tianwen-2 Mission
content: China's Tianwen-2 mission, launched on May 28, 2025, aims to collect samples from the quasi-satellite asteroid 469219 Kamo‘oalewa, potentially a fragment of the Moon. Following this, the spacecraft will journey to comet 311P/PANSTARRS around 2035. This ambitious mission seeks to understand planetary origins, develop new technologies, and enhance China's space exploration capabilities.

title: Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams complete recovery phase
content: Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams completed their Earth return and physical therapy after an extended stay on the ISS due to Starliner complications. They are now involved in Boeing and NASA initiatives, managing post-flight recovery while addressing pre-existing physical issues exacerbated by gravity's return. NASA considers another uncrewed Starliner flight before resuming human missions, pending summer testing results.

title: Hikers call 911 over 'dead' friend, turns out they were high on mushrooms
content: A harrowing 911 call from the Adirondacks led forest rangers to a bizarre scene. Two hikers, under the influence of psychedelic mushrooms, reported their friend dead and themselves lost near Cascade Mountain. Rangers discovered the pair in an altered state, while their supposedly deceased companion was found alive and unharmed, leading to a confused reunion and medical attention for the tripping duo.

title: Early signs of magnesium deficiency that are sometimes ignored
content: One of the most common early signs is muscle cramps or twitches. Magnesium helps muscles relax after they contract. Without enough magnesium, muscles can become tight and cramp easily. You might notice cramps in your legs, especially at night, or small twitches under your skin, causing involuntary movements.

title: IPL 2025 league recap: Teenage ton, pricey flop - the highs and the lows
content: IPL 2025 witnessed Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive entry alongside Rishabh Pant's struggles, amidst a season disrupted by border conflicts. Mumbai Indians staged a comeback, Gujarat Titans maintained composure, and Royal Challengers Bengaluru dominated away games. Punjab Kings exceeded expectations, while Chennai Super Kings faltered, setting the stage for a thrilling playoff showdown.

title: Golden retriever hired as ‘chief happiness officer’ at Hyd startup, wins hearts
content: Hyderabad-based startup Harvesting Robotics has appointed a golden retriever named Denver as its Chief Happiness Officer, sparking online buzz. Co-founder Rahul Arepaka's LinkedIn post introducing Denver went viral, highlighting the pup's role in boosting office morale. The company has embraced a pet-friendly environment, with Denver's presence bringing unexpected positivity.

title: US will 'aggressively revoke' visas for Chinese students: Rubio
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced the US will revoke visas for some Chinese students with ties to the Chinese Communist Party or studying critical fields. This action, coupled with stricter visa guidelines and social media surveillance, intensifies uncertainty for international students. Concerns rise over potential talent deterrence and the erosion of the US as a global education hub, as students express fear of being treated as threats.

title: 'Culprits of 26/11 still scot-free': Owaisi demands Pak's return to FATF grey list
content: As part of an all-party delegation, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi urged for Pakistan's re-inclusion on the FATF grey list to combat terror financing. Speaking in Riyadh, Owaisi accused Pakistan of training terrorist organizations aimed at destabilizing India, citing evidence of Pakistani officials associating with designated terrorists. He criticized Pakistan's inaction regarding the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, despite India providing substantial evidence.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for today
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nifty remains range-bound, potentially retesting lower supports unless it closes above 25050, while Bank Nifty's rising trendline break suggests a possible 1200-1500 point decline. Aakash K Hindocha recommends Chennai Petroleum Corporation, LTIMindtree, and Zydus Lifesciences as buy calls, citing bullish patterns and potential for upward movement in these stocks.

title: Cash-strapped Maharashtra govt OKs Rs 3,000 crore for temples, memorials
content: The Maharashtra government has approved plans worth Rs 2,954 crore for the preservation and renovation of memorials and temples across the state. This includes a Rs 681.3 crore development plan for Ahilyadevi Holkar's memorial and Rs 5,503 crore for seven major pilgrimage centers.

title: Oceans are getting dark, why it’s a wake up call for humanity
content: Satellite data reveals a concerning trend: over 21% of the world's oceans have darkened in the last two decades, shrinking the vital photic zone. This reduction in sunlight penetration threatens marine biodiversity, disrupts ecosystems, and weakens the ocean's ability to regulate climate and produce oxygen.

title: Harbhajan reveals daughter's conversation with Virat after Test retirement
content: Virat Kohli's unexpected retirement from Test cricket ahead of the England tour has surprised fans, marking the end of a significant era. He amassed 9,230 runs in 123 matches, averaging 55.57. Even Harbhajan Singh's daughter, Hinaya, expressed her disappointment, receiving a lighthearted reply from Kohli, who had previously retired from T20Is and will now concentrate on ODIs.

title: UPSC ESE 2025 admit card released: Direct link to download hall tickets here
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has released the e-Admit Cards for the Engineering Services (Preliminary) Examination 2025, scheduled for June 8. Registered candidates can download their hall tickets from upsc.gov.in. Carrying a printed admit card to the exam centre is compulsory, and it must be retained until the final ESE results are announced.

title: Why no Shreyas Iyer for England tour? Coach Gautam Gambhir explains
content: Shubman Gill is set to lead India in the upcoming Test series against England, with Rishabh Pant as vice-captain. Karun Nair makes a comeback after eight years, while Shreyas Iyer is notably absent. Gautam Gambhir declined to comment on Iyer's exclusion. Iyer's leadership will be tested as Punjab Kings face Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL 2025 Qualifier 1.

title: This is the biggest warning sign that occurs before a silent heart attack
content: The most important and common warning sign before a silent heart attack is unusual fatigue—a deep, extreme tiredness that doesn’t get better with rest. This kind of fatigue is different from normal tiredness after a busy day. This takes place because the heart isn’t pumping blood efficiently due to reduced blood flow, leading to less oxygen reaching the body’s tissues

title: To make Harvard 'great again', Trump pushes for 15% cap on foreign students
content: US President Trump advocated for Harvard University to cap international student enrollment at 15% to enhance opportunities for American students. This proposal follows the Trump administration's actions, including freezing $2.2 billion in federal funding and restricting foreign student enrollment, citing concerns over antisemitism and Harvard's governance.

title: Trump used trade for India-Pakistan ceasefire; constraining him could restart conflict: US
content: US authorities, defending President Trump's trade policies in court, claimed his intervention averted a full-scale war between India and Pakistan. They asserted Trump's offer of trade access led to a ceasefire, despite India's denial of his mediation. Officials warned that limiting presidential tariff powers could jeopardize regional security and trade agreements.

title: 'My scheduled time comes to an end': Elon Musk steps down from his role as top adviser to Trump
content: Elon Musk announced his departure as a special government employee and top advisor to President Donald Trump, marking the end of his role in streamlining federal bureaucracy. Musk thanked Trump for the opportunity to reduce wasteful spending, expressing confidence in the future of the DOGE mission. His exit follows criticism of Trump's tax and immigration bill, which Musk described as a "massive spending bill."

title: Stephen Curry’s teammate Podziemski gets latest injury update
content: Golden State Warriors' guard Brandin Podziemski underwent wrist surgery to address discomfort he played through during the postseason. The procedure, a left wrist debridement, aims to improve mobility and healing. Podziemski's shooting percentages dipped in the playoffs, raising questions about the impact of his wrist. Despite struggles, he had standout performances.

title: Federal court blocks Trump’s tariffs imposed under emergency powers
content: A federal court has blocked President Trump's broad tariffs imposed under emergency powers, siding with lawsuits that challenged his authority. The court determined that Trump exceeded his power by using the 1977 International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) to justify tariffs on goods from countries like Canada, China, and Mexico.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi gang’s sharpshooter gunned down in Hapur encounter
content: The operation was launched based on intelligence inputs about the presence of wanted criminals in the region. When intercepted, the suspects opened fire at the police team, triggering a fierce gun battle, said ADG, law and order, Amitabh Yash. Yash said Naveen Kumar was critically injured in the exchange of fire. He was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him dead.

title: John Laurinaitis to provide evidence in Janel Grant's lawsuit against WWE
content: In a significant turn, John Laurinaitis has been dropped from Janel Grant's sex trafficking lawsuit against WWE and Vince McMahon. Laurinaitis has reportedly reached a confidential settlement, agreeing to cooperate with Grant's legal team. This development follows Grant's allegations of sexual misconduct against McMahon and Laurinaitis.

title: Probe 171 alleged fake encounters in 2021: SC to Assam rights panel
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Assam Human Rights Commission (AHRC) to investigate 171 alleged fake encounters by Assam police in 2021. While dismissing a PIL, the court noted the petitioner's claims appeared speculative, except for a few incidents. AHRC will invite victims and families to provide evidence and can select police officials for inquiry.

title: Why does Taylor Swift’s dad despise Blake Lively and protect Justin Baldoni?
content: In a legal drama, Scott Swift stepped in to shield Taylor Swift. He revealed Blake Lively allegedly threatened to leak Taylor's private messages. This was to force Taylor to support her publicly in a $400 million case. Justin Baldoni is suing Blake for defamation. Scott's move led to Baldoni dropping a subpoena for Taylor.

title: Musk bids goodbye to Doge: Netizens ask Grok to summarize his ‘achievements’
content: Elon Musk concludes his tenure as a Special Government Employee leading the Department of Government Efficiency under the Trump 2.0 Administration. He thanks President Trump for the opportunity to cut wasteful spending, expressing confidence in the agency's future impact. His departure follows criticism of Trump's economic policies, sparking varied reactions online regarding his achievements and overall impact.

title: 'Dishonest' vs 'Nationalist': Shashi Tharoor triggers another Congress-BJP slugfest
content: Shashi Tharoor's recent remarks, suggesting India first breached the LoC during the 2016 surgical strike, have ignited a fresh controversy with the Congress and the BJP engaged in a war of words. This follows Tharoor's earlier praise for PM Modi's diplomatic efforts, going against the party line. Congress leaders are countering Tharoor's statements citing past surgical strikes during the UPA regime.

title: Bhool Chuk Maaf box office day 6: Comedy drama crosses the Rs 40 crore mark
content: Karan Sharma's directorial venture, 'Bhool Chuk Maaf,' starring Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi, is performing steadily at the box office. Despite a drop in collections during the weekdays after a strong opening weekend, the comedy-drama has successfully crossed the Rs. 40 crore mark in just six days.

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

title: Power Rankings: Storm surge while Fever fall in latest edition
content: caitlin Clark's quad strain is the type of bad news all WNBA franchises must navigate . the loss of a starter is what keeps coaches and general managers awake at night . last season, the Minnesota Lynx went 3-2 without star forward Napheesa Collier .

title: Previewing the WCWS: Strengths, (relative) weaknesses for every team
content: the 2025 NCAA softball tournament's overall no. 1 seed (Texas A&M) was knocked out before the super regionals . three unseeded teams took top-7 seeds to a third game . both teams lost Game 1 and were in serious trouble late in Game 2 .

title: Panthers move on to Cup Final: Grades, takeaways for both teams
content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Carolina Hurricanes in five to advance to their third consecutive Stanley Cup Final . the defending champions put an end to the discussion, with captain Aleksander Barkov using his strength to fend off Dmitry Orlov to set up Carter Verhaeghe for the series-clinching goal . this is now the 11th time in the past 12 years in which a Sun Belt team has played in the Stanley Cup final .

title: 📷 Trends from OKC's last WCF title
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are on their way back to the NBA Finals . the 124-194 win made the Thunder just the third team to notch multiple series-clinching wins in a postseason . they last reached the finals in 2012 after they defeated Tim Duncan and the San Antonio Spurs in six games .
